title: Trump Invokes Kirk’s Killing in Seeking to Silence Opponents on Left
summary: In the wake of Charlie Kirk’s killing, President Trump and his allies have laid out a broad plan to target liberal groups, monitor speech, revoke visas and designate certain groups as domestic terrorists.

title: Patel Plays the Familiar Role of Pugilist at a Senate Hearing
summary: The F.B.I. director has come under withering attack in recent days, but with Republicans backing him, the proceedings fell into a familiar partisan groove that appeared to play to his strengths.

title: Democrats Oppose Stopgap Bill, Raising Odds of a Shutdown
summary: After allowing a stopgap spending bill to move forward earlier this year, Democrats are under intense pressure not to do so again.

title: G.O.P. Again Cedes Power on Tariffs to Avoid Crossing Trump
summary: House Republicans extended a maneuver they engineered earlier in the year that effectively strips Congress of the power to disapprove of President Trump’s tariffs.

title: Fired by Trump, a Former Labor Official Warns Against Politicizing Economic Data
summary: Erika McEntarfer, in her first appearance since she was ousted from the Bureau of Labor Statistics, cautioned that “economic data must be free from partisan influence.”

title: Robert Redford, Screen Idol Turned Director and Activist, Dies at 89
summary: He made serious topics like grief and political corruption resonate with the masses, in no small part because of his own star power.

title: Robert Redford, American Style Icon
summary: Reluctant to focus on style or his looks, Mr. Redford nevertheless became the embodiment of an enduring aesthetic.

title: Bob Woodward Remembers Robert Redford
summary: Mr. Woodward said Mr. Redford, who portrayed him in the classic 1976 film “All the President’s Men,” was a “genuine, a noble and principled force for good.”

title: Meryl Streep, Barbra Streisand and Others Mourn Robert Redford
summary: Redford “stood for an America we have to keep fighting for,” his frequent collaborator Jane Fonda said after his death was announced on Tuesday.

title: Trump’s Laissez-Faire Stance Gives Netanyahu Free Pass for Gaza Escalation
summary: As Israel mounts a major Gaza offensive, President Trump has neither urged restraint nor endorsed the action, which Israel’s leader has taken as an implicit green light to proceed.

title: Israeli Ground Forces Move Into Gaza City, Sowing Chaos
summary: The long-anticipated military assault is aimed, the Israelis said, at routing the militants of Hamas, but it deepened the humanitarian crisis in the Gaza Strip.

title: It Isn’t Just the U.S. The Whole World Has Soured on Climate Politics.
summary: How do we think about the climate future, now that the era marked by the Paris Agreement has so utterly disappeared?

title: Climate Change’s Toll in Europe This Summer: Thousands of Extra Deaths
summary: Three times as many people in cities and towns died from severe heat as would have done in a world without human-caused warming, scientists said.

title: Has Britain Gone Too Far With Its Digital Controls?
summary: British authorities have ramped up the use of facial recognition, artificial intelligence and internet regulation to address crime and other issues, stoking concerns of surveillance overreach.

title: State Terrorism Charges Against Luigi Mangione Are Dismissed
summary: The judge overseeing the case against Mr. Mangione said the evidence underpinning two of the most serious counts, one of which charged him with first-degree murder, was “legally insufficient.”

title: Democrat Wins Seat of Slain Minnesota Lawmaker, Leaving State House Evenly Split
summary: Xp Lee, a former City Council member, won a special election to replace his political mentor, former Minnesota House Speaker Melissa Hortman, who was assassinated in June.

title: Joe Manchin Would Like a Word. (OK, Maybe Several Words.)
summary: The voluble former senator, now retired from politics, appears to miss the arena and is mulling a return to it.

title: Tina Brown: When Trump Visits King Charles III
summary: He may be the last man standing who can exude global gravitas in the dumpster fire of our digitally dominated world.

title: Our Allies Are Asking: Why Does Putin Still Own Trump?
summary: Ukrainian and European officials, analysts and entrepreneurs keep asking privately, “What’s up with Trump?”

title: San Francisco Politician Recalled Over the Great Highway’s Closure
summary: Supervisor Joel Engardio was ousted by voters who were angry that he helped turn a thoroughfare into a park.

title: A Stone-Skimming Contest in Scotland Is Infiltrated by Cheaters
summary: “I did see some stones that looked a little too perfect,” said the winner of the Stone Skimming World Championships. The offending contestants were disqualified.

title: Pat Crowley, Veteran Actress of Film and TV, Dies at 91
summary: Named the year’s “new star” at the 1954 Golden Globes, she appeared alongside the biggest names of her time. She later embarked on a long career in television.

title: Remnants of Tropical Storm Mario Could Bring Heavy Rain to Southern California
summary: The remains of Tropical Storm Mario could bring flooding to the Los Angeles area. Dry storms with lightning could ignite wildfires in Northern California.
